29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

270195.name: Guardian's Lament
270195.lore:
Together with this visor, the twisted wish of a Guardian also lies broken.
She had wanted to find a way out for her people to escape the Everwinter, but ended up becoming a puppet of a consciousness beyond her.

"Supreme Guardian, the title passed down to generations of Belobog's rulers, the one who looked after all the people — It never occurred to anyone that the Guardians themselves also long for care and protection."

351746.name: Void Cast Iron
351746.desc: Horseshoe of a Voidranger: Trampler. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
351746.lore:
Rare horseshoe obtained when a Trampler of the Antimatter Legion is defeated. When no one is observing, it pops in and out of existence.

"The name of the experiment? It's just called "Horseshoe of the Trampler"... "

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

549437.name: Thief's Instinct
549437.desc: A small amount of anti-matter. Crude material used for enhancement.
549437.lore:
A small amount of anti-matter that emanates out of the Voidranger: Reaver like the materialization of its destructive instinct.

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

633378.name: Usurper's Scheme
633378.desc: A moderate amount of anti-matter. Normal material used for enhancement.
633378.lore:
A moderate amount of anti-matter that floats around the Voidranger: Distorter. The amount of matter and anti-matter particles has reached a dangerous balance...

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

635675.name: Key of Inspiration
635675.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the Meditative Scholars. Used to level up Traces slightly for Erudition characters.
635675.lore:
It can unlock inspirations hidden deep within the conscience.
To take hold of the key is to grasp at the darting embers of thought that lead to the forward path.

"Eureka!"

717319.name: Conqueror's Will
717319.desc: Condensed anti-matter. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717319.lore:
Highly condensed anti-matter within the body of the Voidranger: Trampler. The moment of obliteration is the trumpet call for civilizations' destruction.

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

836261.name: Key of Wisdom
836261.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the greatest prodigies of the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Erudition characters.
836261.lore:
This is the proof of invitation to the halls of the Nous Temple.
Finding the door of which this key opens is a far more arduous task than obtaining the key itself. Those who pass through the doors will immediately realize the impossibility of returning to this side.

"The Erudition does not have answers to the universe, but it will teach you how to ask the right questions."

920202.name: Key of Knowledge
920202.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the sages of the worlds. Used to level up Traces moderately for Erudition characters.
920202.lore:
It can unlock the mysteries binding the truth of the world and grants knowledge beyond the understanding of humans.
No matter how the wielder attempts to display their possession of the key, no one but themselves can see its form. Some people believe that to be a gift from the heavens, while others think it's a sign of mental disorder.

"I had a dream of molecules coiling up into a loop like a snake biting its own tail. I woke up realizing that this is the answer I've been looking for all along!"

ranks.name: Sleep on the Tiles
ranks.descHash: Every time Draw Tile is triggered, Qingque immediately regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy.

ranks.name: Read Between the Tiles
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Right on the Tiles
ranks.descHash:
After using Skill, there is a #1[i]% fixed chance to gain "Self-Sufficer," lasting until the end of the current turn.
While "Self-Sufficer" is active, using Basic ATK or Enhanced Basic ATK immediately launches 1 Follow-up ATK on the same target, dealing Quantum DMG equal to 100% of Basic ATK DMG or Enhanced Basic ATK DMG.

ranks.name: Gambit for the Tiles
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Prevail Beyond the Tiles
ranks.descHash: Recovers 1 Skill Point after using Enhanced Basic ATK.

skills.descHash: Tosses 1 jade tile from the suit with the fewest tiles in hand to deal Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Qingque's ATK to a single enemy.
skills.name: Flower Pick

skills.descHash: Immediately draws #1[i] jade tile(s) and increases DMG by #2[i]% until the end of the current turn. This effect can stack up to #3[i] time(s). The turn will not end after this Skill is used.
skills.name: A Scoop of Moon

skills.descHash: Deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Qingque's ATK to all enemies, and obtains 4 jade tiles of the same suit.
skills.name: A Quartet? Woo-hoo!

skills.descHash:
When an ally's turn starts, Qingque randomly draws 1 tile from 3 different suits and can hold up to 4 tiles at one time.
If Qingque starts her turn with 4 tiles of the same suit, she consumes all tiles to enter the "Hidden Hand" state.
While in this state, Qingque cannot use her Skill again. At the same time, Qingque's ATK increases by #1[i]%, and her Basic ATK "Flower Pick" is enhanced, becoming "Cherry on Top!" The "Hidden Hand" state ends after using "Cherry on Top!".
skills.name: Celestial Jade

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: After using Technique, Qingque draws <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> jade tile(s) when the battle starts.
skills.name: Game Solitaire

skills.descHash:
Deals Quantum DMG equal to #1[i]% of Qingque's ATK to a single enemy, and deals Quantum DMG equal to #2[i]% of Qingque's ATK to enemies adjacent to it.
"Cherry on Top!" cannot recover Skill Points.
skills.name: Cherry on Top!

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Restores 1 Skill Point when using the Skill. This effect can only be triggered 1 time per battle.
embedBonusSkill.name: Tile Battle

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Using the Skill increases DMG Boost effect of attacks by an extra <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Bide Time

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Qingque's SPD increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for 1 turn after using the Enhanced Basic ATK.
embedBonusSkill.name: Winning Hand

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: I'm Qingque, a diviner from the Divination Commission. You wanna play Celestial Jade? Okay, come back during my work hours.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: You're here this early again? So diligent...

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Let's go, let's go, time to play. Are you... thinking of working overtime!?

voiceItems.title: About Self: Work Attitude
voiceItems.text: Work is not about increasing value. It just pays your bills. The trick is to increase value for yourself at your employer's expense.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Divination Commission
voiceItems.text: My Mom said I could relax in a secure job once I passed the Divination Commission entrance exam. Now that I'm in, I feel like I should be doing more...

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: Told off by my manager? Go play some Celestial Jade. Too much work? Go play some Celestial Jade. Ahhhh, Celestial Jade is my savior!

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: I can't play Celestial Jade on my own. How come Celestial Jade isn't omnipotent...

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: There are three basic principles for happiness at work – do not be proactive, do not say no, and do not be responsible. You should give it a try~

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: Fun number one, knowing there are books for leisure on the Xianzhou. Fun number two, browsing these books in the Spare Time Bookshop. Fun number three — the greatest fun — reading those books at work.

voiceItems.title: About Jing Yuan
voiceItems.text: I heard the general often listens to music with his eyes closed. Can we promote that in the Divination Commission? Thank you, general.

voiceItems.title: About Yanqing
voiceItems.text: I've heard his name. A genius boy, and working every day at such a young age? Sounds exhausting.

voiceItems.title: About Fu Xuan
voiceItems.text: As soon as I have free time, the master diviner immediately appears and gives me mundane jobs to do... It looks like I need to work on time management more...

voiceItems.title: About Yukong
voiceItems.text: She's a big shot from the Sky-Faring Commission who can't rest even after retiring from the front lines. It's hard being a powerful official.

voiceItems.title: About Tingyun
voiceItems.text: I saw Tingyun stopping in front of the games parlor once, so I invited her to play a round. Tingyun is pretty and her play is entertaining. People crowded around the game table that day and the mood was on fire. The owner lost all his money — it was great to watch.

voiceItems.title: About Luocha
voiceItems.text: Who? That sounds like an outsider... We've got a lot of outsiders. You'll come across them a lot in The Looking Bronze. He's probably here to seek success in "Seeking Immortality" for himself... Yes, I did say "seek" twice.

voiceItems.title: About Sushang
voiceItems.text: A newcomer with the Cloud Knights? *sigh* Just go back to where she's from. Everything is so competitive here in the Luofu. You can't get promoted.

voiceItems.title: About Bailu
voiceItems.text: I got a bit too excited playing Celestial Jade once and sprained my wrist — a friend recommended her to me. I had my doubts at first, but as soon as she'd written out my prescription, she took out a Celestial Jade set. She told me to practice stacking the tiles to improve wrist flexibility. Naturally, I instantly respected her.

voiceItems.title: About Guinaifen
voiceItems.text: Guinaifen... Oh, you mean Little Gui! Every time I lose at celestial jade, I go watch her acrobatics performance to cheer me up. It's just... I never have enough strale to give her a tip...

voiceItems.title: About Huohuo
voiceItems.text: Every time I spot that kid, I can't help but feel this intense need to teach her how to play Celestial Jade. I've got to teach her the ins and outs...

voiceItems.title: About Xueyi
voiceItems.text: You know that book "An Unsuitable Job for A Puppet?" I didn't just read it, I even scribbled down some notes. Shame, though, I still don't have a clue who wrote it...

voiceItems.title: About Lingsha
voiceItems.text: The Cauldron Master is the worst! A few times when we were chatting, she suddenly said, "The master diviner is coming." I ran behind her to hide, only to find out that no one was actually coming! She's always teasing me like that, so infuriating...

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: Life's just like a game of tiles, you never know what's gonna come up next~

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: When life's all go, the trick is to "steal" a bit of downtime, right?

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: You're bound to draw the tile you want sooner or later, right?

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: When it comes to Celestial Jade, it's all about synergy and luck.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Hey... Trailblazer, you're here, too! Let's get this game going~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Fu Xuan
voiceItems.text: Weird, how'd the Master Diviner figure out I'd be here?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Guinaifen
voiceItems.text: A free performance by Little Gui? There's no way I'm missing that~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Yanqing
voiceItems.text: Awesome, with a genius like Yanqing around, I can take it easy for a while!

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Huohuo
voiceItems.text: No need to worry, Huohuo, the workday zips by when you're having fun~

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Lingsha
voiceItems.text: Alright, no more teasing, okay?

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Play hard, win big, keep quiet~

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: When the odds are against you, cut your losses~

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: Wait for the tiles before you start counting~

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: Fights are like gambling — you have to choose when to strike!

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Don't rush — the game is always changing~

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Don't need this tile~

voiceItems.title: Enhanced Basic Attack
voiceItems.text: Time for the payout.

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Gotcha!

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: Stay calm~

voiceItems.title: Skill 3
voiceItems.text: Come onnnn~

voiceItems.title: Skill 4
voiceItems.text: Ooh~

voiceItems.title: Skill 5
voiceItems.text: Wow~

voiceItems.title: Skill S
voiceItems.text: This hand sucks...

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Fluke.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Sore loser!

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Luck of the draw...!

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: Please, please, please, please, please... ah! Looks like... victory!

voiceItems.title: Talent 1
voiceItems.text: Better late than never!

voiceItems.title: Talent 2
voiceItems.text: That's a set!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: Time for a... day off...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Need an extra player?

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Tasty.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Feeling lucky~

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: We're on a roll, hehe~

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: We're in the money~

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: I could use some of your luck~

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Jackpot!

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: Just another walk in the park~

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: Done! No need for overtime!

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: Time for another round — let's get them~

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: Just thinking about work gives me a full-body migraine...

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
An ordinary diviner at the Divination Commission. She would never slack off in slacking off.
Following her parents' wishes, Qingque qualified for the Divination Commission, but the relaxing post she was expecting was in fact a brutal, high-intensity workplace.
After several years of work, Qingque has honed her skills — no matter which department she's transferred to, she's still the lowest-leveled diviner.
She would browse books and play ancient tile games to wile away the hours... What more could one ask for than a life like this?

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
The legend of Qingque begins at the lyceum.

From the time of Qingque's freshman year right through to her graduation, whenever exam grades were announced, the word Qingque was always followed by a number written out in full: 60, with no exception.

At first, her tutors thought that Qingque was just an average talent unsuitable for academia, so they didn't delve too deeply into things. However, as the same number kept turning up in the examination records, her tutors began to suspect that this wasn't a coincidence at all.

Very soon, having long conversations with the tutors became a common occurrence for Qingque. Anyone familiar with this kind of sophistry will recognize that handful of sayings: At first, she's "quiet and well-behaved," or "gifted." Then, later on, the tone will shift to blame, "A pity that big brain of yours is going to waste," before the grand finale:"If only you could dedicate such ingenuity to your studies, then blah blah blah..."

But Qingque knew the kind of life she wanted far better than her tutors do. She kept repeating "Oh, yes yes yes," and "Mmm sure sure sure," before turning straight around to fall asleep at her desk, and just scraping by during the next exam — this was how Qingque responded to the coercion and threats of her tutors.

They finally ran out of patience with her. In the end, they could only leave behind a resentful message in her yearbook:

"It'd be difficult for her to achieve greatness."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
During the ten-plus years at the Divination Commission, Qingque kept a low-key existence like a harmless little sparrow.

Following her parents' expectations and holding down a steady job, Qingque thought she could breathe a sigh of relief. However, she didn't realize that the Divination Commission — which is in charge of gathering, collecting, and sorting information — is an endless sea of misery for slackers, with no end to the effort it demands. This high-intensity work drove Qingque into torment, from which she could not escape.

However, as the saying goes, "what doesn't kill you only makes you stronger." Struggling through the endless days of being a lifelong "professional," Qingque became a seasoned slacker and learned more than a few slick tricks to loaf on the job. She's transferred throughout the departments and worked under several bosses. Every time, she's always the lowest-leveled diviner, with her numbers threatening to go even lower. It can be said that this has been... pleasing.

However, there are two things that still trouble her. One is visiting her parents during New Year for an annual catch-up, talking about life and her plans for the future — because she doesn't have any plans at all. The other is that pesky boss of hers who's more accurate than a jade abacus at piling new work on her whenever she's busted slacking off.

Qingque is determined to keep improving her time management skills and escape the terror of being pursued by her superior in the Divination Commission. What a shame that Qingque fails to understand fate supersedes her. Her every thought is well within the purview of the omniscia.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
The game of Celestial Jade is supposed to have been around since the days of the Primeval Imperium, but was lost during the Xianzhou Alliance's period of long interstellar drift. Thanks to an anonymous diviner at the Divination Commission, the rules have been collated and brought back to modern-day Xianzhou, where the people are fortunate enough to have access to this mind-boggling tile game based on astrophysics and celestial phenomena.

Of course, rules alone are not enough. That's why the diviner used blueprints from her repository as bait to lure in close colleagues from the Artisanship Commission into crafting Celestial Jade tiles plus a board to play on. The auto-shuffling function is integrated into these boards, and quickly began to catch on in the Quatraboard Games Parlor (which is owned by the Artisanship colleague).

Nowadays, Celestial Jade is one of the most popular games aboard the Xianzhou Luofu. The diviner would joke about this in letters sometimes with her artisan friend. She'd originally wanted to use this game for nothing more than her own leisure, not to capture the hearts of millions of Xianzhou people. Now that's a completely unintended outcome.

"Well, it's not a bad thing..."
"After all... If I can use this leisurely brain game to slack off out in the open, then why not go for it?"

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"Being happy at work is an artform."

"First, never overdo any task. Higher-ups want to see their tasks progressing at a consistent pace before the deadline, so never turn in anything early."

"Second, never take the initiative. If higher-ups don't personally tell you what they want you to do, that is not your problem."

"Third, don't work hard by yourself, and never fight for clout. If you can, try and drag someone in to suffering together with you. Whatever you do, never work alone for the sake of trying to demonstrate any kind of ability."

"Afterward, you can give credit to your peers, both as an easy hat-tip or simple investment into your future. But also as a shield against the possibility of higher-ups promoting you — a promotion means even more work."

"The point is, there are three basic principles for happiness at work – do not be proactive, do not say no, and do not be responsible. Did you get it?"

name: Qingque
descHash: Diviner of the Divination Commission on the Xianzhou Luofu, and a librarian. Always slacks off and is about to be demoted to a "door guardian."
